result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:19 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Hunter Schepper. Defendant Hunter Schepper appeared by video. Court reviews case. ADA Smestad states spoke with Atty Chapman re: discovery issues and will be putting together offer shortly as has victim rights to comply with. Atty Chapman requests 1 more STC. Court sets STC. Adjourned 03:24 PM

Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned

02:01 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Hunter Schepper appeared. Victim Witness and Victim appeared. Court reviews case. Court notes WOPH was signed and Filed. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ARGN:  Atty Chapman reviewed information with DE. Wavied further reading. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Enter NG. Waive Speedy Trial. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 02:09 PM  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Smestad. km
Pre-Signed. Signed by DE. arc
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- NO access to electronic devices with internet capabilities/apps/smartphone. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  L.K.F.  or family. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:06 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Hunter Schepper appeared. Victim witness Atty Chapman states reviewed complaint with DE. Waives further reading. Defendant understands. DE has hired private counsel. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Atty Chapman waives prelim time limits. Court requests waiver to be filed. Court sets PHA. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Chapman. km
